html.p: What: Perform calculations on events while retaining all original events and fields
Why: eventstats creates summary stats of fields without changing total number of events in the results.
So What: Calculated fields while keeping original granularity of data
We're using data we built earlier by using outputlookup. To build this see outputlookup
While yours may differ slightly, that data for us is:

p.pre: | inputlookup rich_and_dave_cars.csv | eventstats avg(cars) as "Avg_cars_per_hour" by salesperson

search.query: | inputlookup rich_and_dave_cars.csv | eventstats avg(cars) as "Avg_cars_per_hour" by salesperson

panel.title: Creating a percent of total field

html.p: | inputlookup rich_and_dave_cars.csv | eventstats sum(cars) as "total_cars" | eval percent_of_total = (('Cars Sold This Hour' / total_cars) * 100) . "%" Also you may notice why you shouldn't use fields with spaces in them.

search.query: | inputlookup rich_and_dave_cars.csv | eventstats sum(cars) as "total_cars" | eval percent_of_total = (('Cars Sold This Hour' / total_cars) * 100) . "%"

html.p: Creates a total per salesperson, then tells you what percentage of that person's sales were each hour. | inputlookup rich_and_dave_cars.csv | eventstats avg(cars) as "total_cars_for_this_salesperson" by salesperson | eval percent_of_total = (('Cars Sold This Hour' / total_cars_for_this_salesperson) * 100) . "%"
